intro: Spaniopappus, commonly known as the woolly sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragweed, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a hairy, branched stem and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Spaniopappus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in dry, rocky soils.
